intro: Mimulopsis macrantha, commonly known as the large-flowered mimulopsis, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Myrtaceae, which includes eucalyptus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, pink or red flowers that bloom in clusters. Its leaves are simple, alternate, and often have a fragrant scent. Mimulopsis macrantha is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
